title: Modular Testbench â€” design agents, TLM interfaces and scoreboards
description: Sketch a reusable testbench with agents for different interfaces, TLM ports for transactions, and a scoreboard for results.

examples.input: Create an 'agent' that contains driver, monitor and sequencer; monitor sends transactions over TLM to scoreboard
examples.output: A modular testbench where each agent can be turned on/off or replaced without touching the DUT-level test code
examples.explanation: Use virtual interfaces and TLM ports for loose coupling and reuse.

constraints: Design for reusability: avoid tight coupling between agent internals and the test harness.
hints: Prefer TLM-2.0 style ports for transaction passing between components.

solution.code: Sketch: env { agent0, agent1 }; agent contains driver/monitor/sequencer; monitor does transactionization and calls scoreboard.write(t). Scoreboard compares with reference model and reports mismatches.
